data.question: When would you typically need to reassign leads from one user to another?
answers: When a user departs from the sub-account

data.question: To bring in human touch points when necessary
answers: To bring in human touch points when necessary
Time-sensitive tasks
Approval processes

data.question: What is the primary purpose of setting up triggers for different calendar types?
answers: To automate messaging and appointment-related actions, by ensuring that the trigger only fires when it should.

data.question: What is the significance of specifying 'recurring event type' as a trigger filter within a workflow?
answers: It ensures the trigger is fired only for recurring appointments

data.question: What is the essential requirement for the 'confirmed' appointment status trigger?
answers: It ensures the system looks for a specific 'status' in the appointment trigger

data.question: How can 'non-confirmed' appointments statuses trigger/fire a workflow?
answers: By using the 'new' status filter for the 'appointment status trigger.'

data.question: What is the purpose of the 'Calendars and Appointments' tab?
answers: To provide a way to see each users calenders and appointments
To show a daily, weekly or monthly overview of appointments and calendars
To display daily appointments only
To highlight past appointments

data.question: How can you integrate your calendar into the system?
answers: By connecting your Google and or Outlook calendar

data.question: What does an appointment marked as 'unconfirmed' mean?
answers: It requires manual confirmation by the user

data.question: What is one of the prerequisites mentioned for using appointment booking features?
answers: Creating a calendar widget and workflows for reminders

data.question: How can users book an appointment on behalf of a contact from within a conversation?
answers: By clicking the 'Book Appointment' button in the conversation preview or within the appointment tab

data.question: How can appointment status triggers be utilized in automation workflows?
answers: To initiate follow-up actions based on appointment status changes

data.question: How can you change the starting day of the week on your calendar?
answers: Through account calendar preferences

data.question: Which meeting link option may not show up if it hasn't been integrated with the user's profile?
answers: Zoom & Google Meet

data.question: What's the difference between calendar availability and user availability?
answers: Calendar availability reflects the business's start time and day of the week, while user availability specifies the user's working hours.

data.question: How does user availability impact appointment bookings?
answers: It influences which team member's availability is considered when a lead books.

data.question: Why is the first row of a CSV file important?
answers: It must not be blank

data.question: What are the contact requirements need for the system to link data back to the contact?
answers: An email or phone number

data.question: Which field type has case-sensitive and spelling-sensitive requirements?
answers: Radio button

data.question: Why is cleaning a CSV file important before uploading?
answers: To prevent sending duplicate SMS
To avoid duplicate messaging
To improve contact organization

data.question: What is the suggested approach to identifying duplicate values?
answers: Highlight columns with conditional formatting

data.question: If not corrected, how are duplicate records typically handled when uploading the file?
answers: The first duplicate is kept

data.question: Why is the 'Remove Duplicates' function in Excel not recommended?
answers: It removes entire contact records

data.question: Who can access the 'Import Contacts' feature?
answers: Location admin

data.question: What is the purpose of using the 'None' option for unique identifiers?
answers: To generate unique contact IDs for each row

data.question: In the mapping view (before importing list), how are unmatched fields handled?
answers: They can be manually mapped (custom fields) or skipped

data.question: When might you enable the 'Allow Duplicate Contacts' setting?
answers: When importing contacts with shared email/phone numbers

data.question: What is the benefit of using contact IDs as identifiers during import?
answers: It helps create records for contacts using the contact ID instead of relying solely on email and phone numbers as the unique identifiers.

data.question: What is one reason for exporting contacts and custom fields?
answers: To perform data analysis in Excel

data.question: Which of the following fields are included in the default export?
answers: Name, email, phone B
Create date, last activity
Tags

data.question: How can additional custom fields be included in an export?
answers: By selecting them in the 'columns' menu

data.question: How can you choose specific contacts for export?
answers: By selecting based on parameters set in your smartlist or manually checking the box next to the contacts name

data.question: What is the primary purpose of smart lists?
answers: To segment leads/contacts based on specific criteria.

data.question: In filtering, what is the function of 'and' conditions?
answers: To combine multiple filters and find leads that meet all conditions.

data.question: What is the purpose of the 'is not' filter option?
answers: To exclude leads that meet a specific condition.

data.question: How can smart lists be shared with other users?
answers: By granting access to users within the 'Manage smart list' area.

data.question: What is the primary purpose of the Company Object feature in the CRM?
answers: To facilitate communication within organizations

data.question: What is the significance of the 'Company Object' feature when dealing with
answers: It centralizes all contacts into a single company entity.

data.question: What is the purpose of creating custom fields in the CRM?
answers: To store specific information about contacts

data.question: What is the purpose of creating and managing tasks within the system?
answers: To remind individuals to complete specific actions.

data.question: Which of the following statements about task assignment is correct?
answers: Tasks can be assigned to users, regardless of their connection to contacts.

data.question: What is the purpose of using internal notifications for task reminders?
answers: To remind users about upcoming tasks.

data.question: What is the purpose of the restore option in the contacts?
answers: To recover accidentally deleted contacts in bulk

data.question: What is restored when you perform a bulk restore of contacts?
answers: Conversation, Notes, Opportunities, Tasks, Appointments, Manual Actions.

data.question: How can you initiate the restoration of contacts individually from the 'Audit Logs'?
answers: By selecting the 'Force Restore' option for the contact in the 'Audit Logs'

data.question: What is the purpose of custom fields in contact records?
answers: To create unique questions and data fields per contact

data.question: How can custom fields be organized for easier access?
answers: By utilizing custom folders to group related fields.

data.question: What advantage does organizing custom fields into folders offer?
answers: Better categorization and prioritization of information

data.question: What are bulk actions used for within the platform's contact tab?
answers: Handling operations on a larger scale

data.question: What types of bulk actions can be performed in the CRM?
answers: Adding tags
Sending emails
Importing contacts

data.question: In the context of bulk email campaigns, which factors can affect the data being returned to the CRM from bulk action(s)?
answers: The SMTP provider used for sending emails

data.question: How can users hide specific pipeline stages from the dashboard view?
answers: By toggling the visibility settings located within the pipeline builder

data.question: What does marking an opportunity as 'Won' typically indicate?
answers: The opportunity has been successfully 'Won' and moved out of the open stage.

data.question: What is the benefit of attributing a lead's value within the pipeline?
answers: It visibly displays the dollar denomination of the lead for the opportunity.

data.question: What is the purpose of automating opportunities within pipelines?
answers: To streamline and standardize opportunity management

data.question: Which automation trigger is suitable for moving contacts between stages?
answers: Pipeline stage changed

data.question: What does the 'Opportunity Status' action allow users to do?
answers: Update the status of an opportunity

data.question: What is the primary purpose of creating invoices in the system?
answers: To keep track of expenses and get paid for services

data.question: Which section of the system should you navigate to in order to create invoices?
answers: Payments

data.question: How can you apply a discount to an invoice?
answers: Manually add it after adding a product to the invoice

data.question: Which statement accurately describes the current capability of adding taxes?
answers: Taxes must be manually added to invoices as they are not currently supported on checkout forms.

data.question: In the system, how are taxes associated with specific clients or business locations?
answers: Taxes must be manually pre-built and linked to corresponding clients.

data.question: How can taxes be integrated with SaaS payment links in the system?
answers: Taxes are set up using the SaaS configurator for Stripe checkout.

data.question: Which payment gateways can be integrated to enable the creation of invoices?
answers: Both PayPal and Stripe

data.question: What is the purpose of enabling auto-payment for recurring invoices?
answers: To automatically charge the same card used for the first payment

data.question: Which of the following statements are true about recurring invoices?
answers: Recurring invoices can be created for subscription-based products.
Discounts can be applied to items in recurring invoices.
Recurring invoices can be scheduled to be sent monthly, weekly, or yearly.

data.question: Which of the following details are listed for each subscription?
answers: Status of the subscription

data.question: Who can access the Subscription page?
answers: Users on any plan

data.question: What filters are available on the Subscription page? (Select all that apply)
answers: Subscription status

data.question: What information is displayed on the Orders page?
answers: Customer names, source of order, and order status

data.question: Is the Orders page available for all pricing plans?
answers: Yes

data.question: What information about the ordered items can users find on the Orders page?
answers: Item names and the quantity ordered

data.question: What is the purpose of the transactions page?
answers: To track customer payments

data.question: What information is displayed for each transaction on the transactions page?
answers: Transaction date
Payment source

data.question: How can you filter transactions on the transactions page? (Select all that apply)
answers: By payment mode

data.question: Which section under the account or location should you navigate to in order to find products?
answers: Payments

data.question: Which payment option listed below does NOT support products? (The user would need to manually input the monetary value)
answers: Text to pay

data.question: What Payment integrations are offered in the system? (Select all that apply)
answers: Stripe
Authorize.net
Paypal
NMI

data.question: Which type of products can be added to an order form?
answers: Products that have been previously created/ imported

data.question: What determines whether a product is a main product or a bump product?
answers: A specific option is selected when adding the product to the page where it will be sold

data.question: How can users verify the products added to the order form?
answers: By previewing the page with the order form

data.question: What does the text-to-pay links feature allow users to do?
answers: Request manual payments through the Conversations tab

data.question: What payment processor is needed to utlize the 'text-to-pay' links feature?
answers: Stripe

data.question: What can users customize when creating text-to-pay a payment request?
answers: Product name, price, due date, and additional options

data.question: What are the two main types of coupons mentioned in the video? (Select all that apply)
answers: Fixed coupons
Percentage coupons

data.question: What can you restrict when creating a coupon? (Select all that apply)
answers: Number of redemptions
Specific products

data.question: What information is needed to enable automatic sales receipts? (Select all that apply)
answers: Title
Receipt prefix
Receipt start number
Email template

data.question: Which functionality is not available in payment settings?
answers: Customizing payment links

data.question: What is the purpose of adding tax information in payment settings?
answers: To specify the tax rate and details for invoices

data.question: What is the purpose of A/B split testing in email campaigns?
answers: To analyze the success of subject lines and content variations

data.question: What is the minimum number of contacts required for a split test with six variations?
answers: 60 contacts

data.question: What does the 'version history' feature allow users to do?
answers: Restore previous template versions

data.question: Why is using email providers like Mailgun or LC email recommended?
answers: They have direct API integration for better data tracking.

data.question: What does RSS scheduling allow you to do?
answers: Send emails in response to RSS feed updates.

data.question: In the context of email campaigns, what does the 'unique open rate' represent?
answers: The percentage of contacts who opened the email at least once.

data.question: What is the primary purpose of a trigger link?
answers: To attribute clicks and trigger actions in workflows.

data.question: Which type of communication channels can trigger links be used in?
answers: SMS and email

data.question: How can a trigger link be used to initiate a workflow?
answers: By selecting the trigger link 'Trigger' in the workflow settings.

data.question: Where can you find workflows within the system?
answers: Automation tab of the sub account or location

data.question: What are workflow triggers?
answers: Actions that initiate specific sequence of events

data.question: What does the 'allow reentry' setting in workflows do when enabled?
answers: Allows contacts to re-enter an active workflow

data.question: Which of the following actions can be performed within workflows? (Select all that apply)
answers: Sending automated emails or SMS
Assigning tasks to users

data.question: What does the 'marked as read' setting in communication settings do?
answers: Marks all outgoing automated messages as read in the conversation tab

data.question: Why would someone choose to build a workflow instead of using the default auto-missed call text-back feature in sub-accounts? (Select all that apply)
answers: Throttle options

data.question: What is the purpose of the auto-missed call text back feature?
answers: To prevent missed opportunities
Quicker response to missed calls.
Capture the leads interest before they move onto the next business

data.question: Where would a user disable the default auto-missed call text back feature for newly generated sub-accounts?
answers: Within the business profile settings located in the sub-account settings

data.question: What is the purpose of the 'No Show Nurture' recipe?
answers: To promote rescheduling after no-shows

data.question: What trigger would be required for a No-Show workflow to fire/execute when the appointment status is set to 'No Show'?
answers: 'Appointment Status' triggers with an appointment status filter set to 'No-show'.

data.question: Why is it important to remove leads from the 'No Show Nurture' after booking?
answers: To avoid overwhelming users with unintentional messages urging them to book, etc.

data.question: How can you grant a user access to a specific feature if they can't see it?
answers: Adjust the user's permissions and ensure that the sub-account has the specific feature enabled within the agency view.

data.question: On which subscription plan is the split-testing feature available in the Funnel Builder?
answers: All subscription plans

data.question: What is the process to add a product to a page in the Funnel Builder?
answers: Create the product under payments, then add it to the page

data.question: Which option is NOT available under the settings section of the Funnel Builder?
answers: adding a domains DNS records

data.question: Why can't a single domain be used for both hosting a website and sending emails?
answers: Each domain must have a dedicated purpose to avoid conflicts

data.question: What does DNS propagation refer to?
answers: The time it takes for DNS records to be added and mapped

data.question: What is the purpose of a 'custom 404 page'?
answers: To handle broken links and user input errors in URLs.

data.question: What is the purpose of the 'layers' feature within the page builder?
answers: To highlight specific sections and navigate within containers.

data.question: Which elements can you add to your page to display videos?
answers: Hosted videos, HTML5 videos, YouTube videos, and more.

data.question: What is the purpose of the 'two-step order form' element?
answers: It requires users to enter their contact details before proceeding to payment.

data.question: How can you customize the appearance of navigation menus in the page builder?
answers: By adjusting spacing, colors, typography, and more.

data.question: What can you achieve by using the SEO metadata settings?
answers: Optimize the page's appearance on search engine results.

data.question: What is one of the main use cases of forms mentioned in the video?
answers: Collecting data from users/leads

data.question: What is the purpose of the 'Analyze' tab for forms?
answers: To view and categorize form submissions

data.question: Which type of field is suitable for alphanumeric input?
answers: Single or multi line

data.question: How can forms be added to funnels and websites in the builder?
answers: Using the native 'form element' in the page builder

data.question: When embedding forms in third-party platforms, what is the purpose of the 'Copy Embed' option?
answers: To obtain the embed code for the form

data.question: Where would you connect a custom form to a calendar?
answers: Calendar customization settings

data.question: What is the primary focus of the tutorial?
answers: Form-triggered workflow and notification

data.question: What is the purpose of a trigger in a workflow?
answers: To activate actions in the workflow

data.question: How does the tutorial suggest redirecting 'users' (not leads) upon clicking the notification?
answers: By using the 'Internal action' action in the workflow

data.question: What is the purpose of setting up a workflow for survey submissions?
answers: To automate notifications and actions based on survey responses

data.question: What is the purpose of setting up a workflow for survey submissions?
answers: To facilitate discussion, learning, networking, and knowledge sharing

data.question: What is the purpose of the client-facing portal discussed in the video?
answers: To provide a link for customers to log-in or sign-up.

data.question: In a group, which roles can approve or decline membership requests? (Select all that apply)
answers: Admins

data.question: What is the purpose of reputation management in the system
answers: To manage and improve online reviews improve SEO rankings and keep business content new and relevant

data.question: How can users customize the review widget's appearance?
answers: By selecting customizable options within the reputation management tab, located in the sub-account settings.

data.question: How can you customize the messaging for email and SMS review requests?
answers: By enabling the respective options and editing the copy and messaging in the reputation settings section

data.question: What is the prerequisite for accessing notification settings, as demonstrated in the video?
answers: Being a user within that sub-account, or being 'logged in' as the user within the sub-account

data.question: How does configuring user profile notifications contribute to workflow management?
answers: It can reduce the number of internal notifications needed for day to day communications.

data.question: How can users access SMS compliance customization settings?
answers: In the sub-account's settings
